greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: For any number n with binary expansion Sum_{k >= 0} b(k) * 2^k, the binary expansion of a(n) is Sum_{k >= 0} floor((b(k) + b(k+1) + b(k+2))/2) * 2^k.
comment: The value of the k-th bit in a(n) corresponds to the most frequent value in the bit triple starting at the k-th bit in n.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8192
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: a(n) = 0 iff n belongs to A048715.
example: The first terms, in decimal and in binary, are:
